attributes.action: Challenge councils branding of Dyslexia as ‘scientifically questionable’.
attributes.background: Further to the article “Dyslexia no longer being diagnosed by councils who called Dyslexia ‘scientifically questionable’ .” in the Daily Telegraph on 11/01/2018, I call on the councils named in the article; Warwickshire and Staffordshire to publicly apologise and continue to diagnose Dyslexia.

rejection.details:
This would the responsibility of the local authorities concerned and not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You could start a new petition calling on the UK Government to issue national guidance on the diagnosis of dyslexia if that is something you would like to see happen.
